column2: Life doesn't get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
When I dare to be powerful to use my strength in the service of my vision then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid.
Like tiny seeds with potent power to push through tough ground and become mighty trees, we hold innate reserves of unimaginable strength. We are resilient.
When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace.
Peace is a day-to-day problem, the product of a multitude of events and judgments. Peace is not an 'is,' it is a 'becoming.'
Inner peace doesn't come from getting what we want, but from remembering who we are.
Peace is its own reward.
It isn't enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn't enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
Optimism is a strategy for making a better future. Because unless you believe that the future can be better, you are unlikely to step up and take responsibility for making it so.
And you ask "what if I fall?" Oh but my darling, what if you fly?"
It's not that optimism solves all of life's problems; it is just that it can sometimes make the difference between coping and collapsing.
Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
No pessimist ever discovered the secrets of the stars, or sailed to an uncharted land, or opened a new heaven to the horizon of the spirit.
Stay afraid, but do it anyway. What's important is the action. You don't have to wait to be confident. Just do it and eventually the confidence will follow.
One must have the adventurous daring to accept oneself as a bundle of possibilities and undertake the most interesting game in the world, making the most of one's best.
Be proud to wear you.
I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence but it comes from within. It is there all the time.
Every small positive change we make in ourselves repays us in confidence in the future.
Love does not dominate; it cultivates.
There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature.
Love in action is service.
Where there is love there is life.
At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
A friend may be waiting behind a stranger's face.
Wherever we are, it is our friends that make our world.
Find a group of people who challenge and inspire you; spend a lot of time with them, and it will change your life.
There's not a word yet for old friends who've just met.
There are good ships and wood ships, ships that sail the sea, but the best ships are friendships, may they always be!
At 211 degrees, water is hot. At 212 degrees, it boils. And with boiling water, comes steam. And with steam, you can power a train.
The key of persistence opens all doors closed by resistance.
You keep putting one foot in front of the other, and then one day you look back and you've climbed a mountain.
To persist with a goal, you must treasure the dream more than the costs of sacrifice to attain it.
Failure cannot cope with persistence.
Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
A highly developed values system is like a compass. It serves as a guide to point you in the right direction when you are lost.
Just don't give up trying what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.
When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too.
The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great in whatever they want to do.

Bad things do happen; how I respond to them defines my character and the quality of my life. I can choose to sit in perpetual sadness… or I can choose to rise from the pain and treasure the most precious gift I have—life itself.
Show me someone who has done something worthwhile, and I'll show you someone who has overcome adversity.
It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it.
Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars. You have to let go at some point in order to move forward.
If you can't fly then run, if you can't run then walk, if you can't walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward.
The creative is the place where no one else has ever been. You have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition.
Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
I am the me I choose to be.
Creative people do not see things for what they are; they see them for what they can be.
There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
Hope is a state of mind, not of the world. Hope, in this deep and powerful sense, is not the same as joy that things are going well…, but rather an ability to work for something because it is good.
Just as one cannot live without dreams, one cannot live without hope. If dreams reflect the past, hope summons the future.
We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering 'it will be happier'…
What greater thing is there for human souls than to feel that they are joined for life, to be with each other in silent unspeakable memories.
It didn't matter how big our house was; it mattered that there was love in it.
The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life. Rarely do members of one family grow up under the same roof.
Having somewhere to go is home, having someone to love is family, having both is blessing.
Do your little bit of good where you are; its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.

This is my wish for you: peace of mind, prosperity through the year, happiness that multiplies, health for you and yours, fun around every corner, energy to chase your dreams, joy to fill your holidays!
Laughing cheerfulness throws the light of day on all the paths of life.
After every storm the sun will smile; for every problem there is a solution, and the soul's indefeasible duty is to be of good cheer.
I say to myself that I shall try to make my life like an open fireplace, so that people may be warmed and cheered by it and so go out themselves to warm and cheer.
The unselfish effort to bring cheer to others will be the beginning of a happier life for ourselves.
I have found that among its other benefits, giving liberates the soul of the giver.
If you have much, give of your wealth; if you have little, give of your heart.
Remember that the happiest people are not those getting more, but those giving more.
The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but to reveal to them their own.
Giving is not just about making a donation, it's about making a difference.
Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
Choose love and peace will follow. Choose peace and love will follow.

Ultimately, we have just one moral duty: to reclaim large areas of peace in ourselves…,and to reflect it towards others. And the more peace there is in us, the more peace there will be in our troubled world.
It is tenderness for the past, courage for the present, hope for the future.  It is a fervent wish that every cup may overflow with blessings rich and eternal, and that every path may lead to peace.
Use your voice for kindness, your ears for compassion, your hands for charity, your mind for truth, and your heart for love.
Fear grows out of the things we think; it lives in our minds. Compassion grows out of the things we are, and lives in our hearts.
Our human compassion binds us the one to the other, not in pity or patronizingly, but as human beings who have learnt how to turn our common suffering into hope for the future.
True compassion means not only feeling another's pain but also being moved to help relieve it.
There is nobility in compassion, a beauty in empathy, a grace in forgiveness.
Two kinds of gratitude: the sudden kind we feel for what we take; the larger kind we feel for what we give.
Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.
As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
It's a funny thing about life, once you begin to take note of the things you are grateful for, you begin to lose sight of the things that you lack.
Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
Humility isn't denying your strengths; it's being honest about your weaknesses.
True humility is being able to accept criticisms as graciously as we accept compliments.
I claim to be a simple individual liable to err like any other fellow mortal. I own, however, that I have humility enough to confess my errors and to retrace my steps.
Humility is the ability to give up your pride and still retain your dignity.
Pride is concerned with who is right. Humility is concerned with what is right.
There is a loftier ambition than merely to stand high in the world. It is to stoop down and lift mankind a little higher.

Your ambition should be to get as much life out of living as you possibly can, as much enjoyment, as much interest, as much experience, as much understanding. Not simply be what is generally called a 'success.'
Ambition is enthusiasm with a purpose.
Ambition, fueled by compassion, wisdom and integrity, is a powerful force for good that will turn the wheels of industry and open the doors of opportunity for you and countless others.
When your ambition is greater than your fear, your life will get bigger than your dream.
The strongest trust is built by the smallest actions, the keeping of the little promises.
You don't earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day-by-day.
Loyalty is the pledge of truth to oneself and others.
No more important duty can be urged upon those who are entering the great theater of life than simple loyalty to their best convictions.
You cannot buy loyalty; you cannot buy the devotion of hearts, minds, and souls. You have to earn these things.

Grit is that 'extra something' that separates the most successful people from the rest. It's the passion, perseverance, and stamina that we must channel in order to stick with our dreams until they become a reality.
Grit is the grain of character.
We like to think of our champions and idols as superheroes who were born different from us. We don't like to think of them as relatively ordinary people who made themselves extraordinary.
The same boiling water that softens the potato hardens the egg. It's about what you're made of, not the circumstances.
What we accomplish in the marathon of life depends tremendously on our grit—our passion and perseverance for long-term goals.
I don't like to gamble, but if there's one thing I'm willing to bet on, it's myself.
Put all excuses aside and remember this: You are capable.
Magic is believing in yourself, if you can do that, you can make anything happen.
Talk to yourself like you would to someone you love.
Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.
A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
The ideals which have lighted my way, and time after time have given me new courage to face life cheerfully, have been kindness, beauty and truth.
Sometimes miracles are just good people with kind hearts.
No act of kindness is too small. The gift of kindness may start as a small ripple that over time can turn into a tidal wave affecting the lives of many.
Ah, kindness. What a simple way to tell another struggling soul that there is love to be found in the world.
Education is for improving the lives of others and for leaving your community and world better than you found it.
Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
The best teachers are those who show you where to look but don't tell you what to see.
Education is a social process. Education is growth. Education is not a preparation for life; education is life itself.
Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today.
In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts.

To find the universal elements enough; to find the air and the water exhilarating; to be refreshed by a morning walk or an evening saunter… to be thrilled by the stars at night—these are some of the rewards of the simple life.
We do not inherit the land from our ancestors, we borrow it from our children.
Those who find beauty in all of nature will find themselves at one with the secrets of life itself.
Integrity is the choice between what's convenient and what's right.
When you say 'yes' to others, make sure you aren't saying 'no' to yourself.
Integrity is what we say, what we do, and what we say we do.
Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.
If you don't stick to your values when they are being tested, they're not values: they're hobbies.
An exchange of empathy provides an entry point for a lot of people to see what healing feels like.
Whenever you are about to find fault with someone, ask yourself the following question: What fault of mine most nearly resembles the one I am about to criticize?
We think we listen, but very rarely do we listen with real understanding, true empathy. Yet listening, of this very special kind, is one of the most potent forces for change that I know.
Empathy is about finding echoes of another person in yourself.

How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving, and tolerant of the weak and the strong, because someday in your life, you will have been all of these.
Self-care is not self-indulgence, it is self-preservation.
There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
Rest and self-care are so important. When you take time to replenish your spirit, it allows you to serve from the overflow. You cannot serve from an empty vessel.
Mind. Body. Soul. These are the three things self-care is all about.

The people closest to me determine my level of success or failure. The better they are, the better I am. And if I want to go to the highest level, I can do it only with the help of other people. We have to take each other higher.
Cooperation is the thorough conviction that nobody can get there unless everybody gets there.
The strength of the team is each individual member. The strength of each member is the team.
Problems can become opportunities when the right people come together.
Individual commitment to a group effort, that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.
It is easier to reach our potential when we learn the value of including others in our quest.
To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow—this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.
Have a big enough heart to love unconditionally, and a broad enough mind to embrace the differences that make each of us unique.
Acceptance is simply love in practice. When you love, you accept, when you lack love, you judge.
The happiness of one's own heart alone cannot satisfy the soul; one must try to include, as necessary to one's own happiness, the happiness of others.
Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become.
Courage doesn't mean you don't get afraid. Courage means you don't let fear stop you.
Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
In one of its earliest forms, the word courage meant 'To speak one's mind by telling all one's heart.'
Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
The only failure is quitting. Everything else is just gathering information.
There's only one way to succeed in anything, and that is to give it everything.
In the confrontation between the stream and the rock, the stream always wins- not through strength but by perseverance.
A good laugh heals a lot of hurts.
Laughter lightens the soul.
Laughter lets me relax. It's the equivalent of taking a deep breath, letting it out and saying, 'This, too, will pass.'
I have seen what a laugh can do. It can transform almost unbearable tears into something bearable, even hopeful.
Laughter is proof of hope.
Now is no time to think of what you do not have. Think of what you can do with what there is.
The mind is like a flower. It does not bloom without the lights of appreciation, encouragement, and love.
Enjoy the little things in life, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.

We should cultivate the ability to say no to activities for which we have no interest or real concern. If we learn to say no to many things, then we will be able to say yes to the things that matter most.
The vision must be followed by the venture. It is not enough to stare up the steps, we must step up the stairs.
Don't stop until you're proud.
Good, better, best. Never let it rest. Until your good is better and your better is best.

When you look for things in life like love, meaning, motivation, it implies they are sitting behind a tree or under a rock. The most successful people in life recognize, that in life they create their own love, they manufacture their own meaning, they generate their own motivation.
It's your reaction to adversity, not adversity itself that determines how your life's story will develop.
Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.
Sometimes, carrying on, just carrying on, is the superhuman achievement.
We will either find a way, or make one.
Persistence and resilience only come from having been given the chance to work though difficult problems.
Striving for success without hard work is like trying to harvest where you haven't planted.
Work hard and be kind and amazing things will happen.
If you go to work on your goals, your goals will go to work on you. If you go to work on your plan, your plan will go to work on you. Whatever good things we build end up building us.
The fruit of your own hard work is the sweetest.
If your dream is a big dream, and if you want your life to work on the high level you say you do, there's no way around doing the work it takes to get you there.
For the strength of the Pack is the Wolf, and the strength of the Wolf is the Pack.
No doubt, unity is something to be desired, to be striven for, but it cannot be willed by mere declarations.
We are each other's harvest; we are each other's business; we are each other's magnitude and bond.
It is not in numbers, but in unity, that our great strength lies.
So powerful is the light of unity that it can illuminate the whole earth.
If it doesn't challenge you, it doesn't change you.
Fitness is not about being better than someone else. It's about being better than you used to be.
Energy and persistence conquer all things.
The purpose of training is to tighten up the slack, toughen the body, and polish the spirit.
Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basic of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.
The delicate balance of mentoring someone is not creating them in your own image, but giving them the opportunity to create themselves.
A good coach can change a game. A great coach can change a life.
Mentoring is a brain to pick, an ear to listen, and a push in the right direction.
My mentor said, 'Let's go do it,' not 'You go do it.' How powerful when someone says, 'Let's!'.
A mentor is someone who sees more talent and ability within you, than you see in yourself, and helps bring it out of you.
An early morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.
The antidote to exhaustion isn't rest. It's nature.
I go to nature to be soothed and healed, and to have my senses put in order.
The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun.
Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt.
No matter where you're from, your dreams are valid.
Follow your dreams, they know the way.
Don't ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and go do it. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive.
You're off to Great Places! Today is your day! Your mountain is waiting, So… get on your way!
Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
If your actions create a legacy that inspires others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, then, you are an excellent leader.
One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
Before you are a leader, success is all about growing yourself. When you become a leader, success is all about growing others.
A leader is a dealer in hope.

A true leader has the confidence to stand alone, the courage to make tough decisions, and the compassion to listen to the needs of others. They do not set out to be a leader, but become one by the equality of their actions and the integrity of their intentions.
I think the next best thing to solving a problem is finding some humor in it.
Good humor is the sunshine of the mind.
Laugh as much as possible, always laugh. It's the sweetest thing one can do for oneself and one's fellow human beings.
You may not be able to change a situation, but with humor you can change your attitude about it.
Into each day, put in about one teaspoonful of good spirits, a dash of fun, a pinch of folly, a sprinkling of play, and a heaping cupful of good humor!
Practice puts brains in your muscles.
Always dream and shoot higher than you know you can do. Do not bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.
Practice isn't the thing you do once you're good. It's the thing you do that makes you good.
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Everything we do is practice for something greater than where we currently are.  Practice only makes for improvement.
If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
I am of the opinion that my life belongs to the whole community and as long as I live, it is my privilege to do for it whatever I can.
The greatness of a community is most accurately measured by the compassionate actions of its members.
There is no power for change greater than a community discovering what it cares about.
Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.
Sometimes your only available transportation is a leap of faith.
Be strong, go with your heart, and believe in miracles because anything…anything can happen.
And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it.
To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
Forgive, forget. Bear with the faults of others as you would have them bear with yours.
It's not an easy journey, to get to a place where you forgive people. But it is such a powerful place, because it frees you.
True forgiveness is when you can say 'Thank you for that experience'.
Forgiveness says you are given another chance to make a new beginning.
What would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?
I have a habit of letting my imagination run away from me. It always comes back though… drenched with possibilities.
Imagination is not just the catalyst of art, it's also the catalyst of compassion.
Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
You have all the reason in the world to achieve your grandest dreams. Imagination plus innovation equals realization.
Patience is more than simply learning to wait. It is having learned what is worth your time.
Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
Patience is a form of wisdom. It demonstrates that we understand and accept the fact that sometimes things must unfold in their own time.
Patience is not simply the ability to wait, it's how we behave while we're waiting.
Patience is power. Patience is not an absence of action; rather it is "timing" it waits on the right time to act, for the right principles and in the right way.
Compassion for others begins with kindness to ourselves.
A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.
Our task must be to widen our circle of compassion, to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty.
There never was any heart truly great and generous, that was not also tender and compassionate.
Compassion is a power that we first bestow on ourselves and then give away through our actions—to people, to our planet. When we recognize this, that is when love becomes our legacy.
Surrender to what is, let go of what was, have faith in what will be.
Your vision will become clear only when you look into your heart. Who looks outside, dreams. Who looks inside awakens.
Mindfulness is not a mechanical process. It is developing a very gentle, kind, and creative awareness to the present moment.
A few simple tips for life: feet on the ground, head to the skies, heart open-quiet mind.

Mindfulness is the aware, balanced acceptance of the present experience… It is opening to or receiving the present moment, pleasant or unpleasant, just as it is, without either clinging to it or rejecting it.
Creativity is thinking up new things. Innovation is doing new things.
Innovation is taking two things that already exist and putting them together in a new way.
Innovation is the ability to see change as an opportunity – not a threat.
The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers. But above all what the world needs most are dreamers that do.
What good is an idea if it remains an idea? Try. Experiment. Iterate. Fail. Try again. Change the world.
Nobody grows old by merely living a number of years. People grow old by deserting their ideals. Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up wrinkles the soul.
Fall seven times, stand up eight.
Some succeed because they are destined to, but most succeed because they are determined to.
If you have made mistakes, even serious ones, there is always another chance for you.  What we call failure is not the falling down, but the staying down.
There is no chance, no destiny, no fate, that can hinder or control the firm resolve of a determined soul.
Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.
The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
Friends are the family you choose.
Anything is possible when you have the right people there to support you.
Friends are medicine for a wounded heart and vitamins for a hopeful soul.
Find life experiences and swallow them whole. Travel. Meet many people. Exhaust yourself in the glorious pursuit of life.
Do not let making a living prevent you from making a life.

You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself in any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. You are the one who'll decide where to go.
The person who has lived the most is not the one with the most years, but the one with the richest experiences.
Life itself is a privilege. But to live life to the fullest- well, that is a choice.
Your circumstance doesn't make life extraordinary. Love does.
And still, after all this time, the Sun has never said to the Earth,'You owe me.' Look what happens with love like that. It lights up the sky.
You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe deserve your love and affection.
The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
Let us see what love can do.
Believing that the dots will connect down the road will give you the confidence to follow your heart.
As is our confidence, so is our capacity.
What lies behind you and what lies in front of you pales in comparison to what lies inside you.
Live from the heart of yourself. Seek to be whole, not perfect.
Personality begins where comparison leaves off. Be unique. Be memorable. Be confident. Be proud.
Bravery shows up in everyday life when people have the courage to live their truth, their vision and their dreams.
Only when we're brave enough to explore the darkness will we discover the infinite power of our light.
Bravery is the audacity to be unhindered by failures, and to walk with freedom, strength, and hope, in the face of things unknown.
Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.
There is always light, if only we're brave enough to see it. If only we're brave enough to be it.
Give me six hours to chop down a tree, and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
First, I prepare. Then I have faith.
We cannot always build the future for our youth, but we can build our youth for the future.
Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap, but by the seeds that you plant.
It's not the will to win that matters-everyone has that. It's the will to prepare to win that matters.
You can easily judge the character of others by how they treat those who can do nothing for them.
The greatest discovery of our generation is that human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind. As you think, so shall you be.
What we know matters but who we are matters more.
The truth of your character is expressed through the choice of your actions.
A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
When we create peace and harmony and balance in our minds, we will find it in our lives.
When we have peace in our hearts and minds, we draw peace into our lives.
Peace. It does not mean to be in a place where there is no noise, trouble or hard work. It means to be in the midst of those things and still be calm in your heart.
When you stay on purpose and refuse to be discouraged by fear, you align with the infinite self, in which all possibilities exist.
The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.

When you know who you are; when your mission is clear and you burn with the inner fire of unbreakable will; no cold can touch your heart; no deluge can dampen your purpose. You know that you are alive.
There is no greater gift you can give or receive than to honor your calling. It's why you were born. And how you become most truly alive.
If you can't figure out your purpose, figure out your passion. For your passion will lead you right into your purpose.
Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
And suddenly you know: It's time to start something new and trust the magic of beginnings.
The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
What the new year brings to you will depend a great deal on what you bring to the new year.
The joy of brightening other lives, bearing each others' burdens, easing others' loads and supplanting empty hearts and lives with generous gifts becomes for us the magic of the holidays.
May your walls know joy, may every room hold laughter, and every window open to great possibility.
Joy is increased by spreading it to others.
Joy is the holy fire that keeps our purpose warm and our intelligence aglow.
Balance, peace, and joy are the fruit of a successful life. It starts with recognizing your talents and finding ways to serve others by using them.
Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
I would like for my life to be a statement of love and compassion- and where it isn't, that's where my work lies.
You always gain by giving love.
We can't heal the world today. But we can begin with a voice of compassion, a heart of love, and an act of kindness.
Blessed is the season which engages the whole world in a conspiracy of love.
Do things for people not because of who they are or what they do in return, but because of who you are.
Always be a little kinder than necessary.
Simple kindness may be the most vital key to the riddle of how human beings can live with each other in peace, and care properly for this planet we all share.
Extend yourself in kindness to other human beings wherever you can.
Courage. Kindness. Friendship. Character. These are the qualities that define us as human beings, and propel us, on occasion, to greatness.
It is our privilege and our adventure to discover our own special light.
Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
The big challenge is to become all that you have the possibility of becoming.
Just remember, when it comes to your life, you are not only the artist but the masterpiece, as well.
Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more.

We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.

Most people are like you and me, or the people across the street or around the world from you and me. Just like you and me, their hearts tell them that somewhere, somehow, they can make a positive difference in the world.
Aim to make a difference in someone's life every single day, including your own.
It takes each of us to make a difference for all of us.
Never underestimate the valuable and important difference you make in every life you touch for the impact you make today has a powerful rippling effect on every tomorrow.
What you do makes a difference and you have to decide what kind of a difference you want to make.
I believe in the spirit of equality and the spirit of this country as one of love and compassion and kindness.
We all came in on different ships, but we're all in the same boat now.
The diversity in the human family should be the cause of love and harmony, as it is in music where many different notes blend together in the making of a perfect chord.
Nurturing an inclusive culture begins in the family. Home is the first place to foster openness and a culture of inclusion.
We could learn a lot from crayons; some are sharp, some are pretty, some are dull, while others bright, some have weird names, but they all have learned to live together in the same box.

Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness, that frightens us most. We ask ourselves, who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented and fabulous? Actually who are you not to be?
Your self-worth is determined by you. You don't have to depend on someone telling you who you are.
Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.
When I was a child my mother said to me, 'If you become a soldier, you'll be a general. If you become a monk, you'll be the pope.' Instead I became a painter and wound up as Picasso.
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
Trying is winning in the moment.
Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time.
Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.
Nothing really worth having is easy to get. The hard-fought battles, the goals won with sacrifice, are the ones that matter.
We carry within us, the wonders we seek around us.
Always be on the lookout for the presence of wonder.
Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
There are no great limits to growth because there are no limits of human intelligence, imagination, and wonder.
Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
When it comes to health and well-being, regular exercise is about as close to a magic potion as you can get.
Movement is a medicine for creating change in a person's physical, emotional, and mental states.
A bear, however hard he tries, grows tubby without exercise.
True enjoyment comes from activity of the mind and exercise of the body; the two are ever united.
Fitness helps me think better, feel better, and move better.
To practice any art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow. So do it.
Make visible what, without you, might perhaps never have been seen.
What is creative living? Any life that is driven more strongly by curiosity than by fear.
The most creative act you will ever undertake is the act of creating yourself.
The desire to create is one of the deepest yearnings of the human soul.
We have become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams.
All for one and one for all, united we stand divided we fall.
Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
Service to a just cause rewards the worker with more real happiness and satisfaction than any other venture of life.
Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on earth.

Wherever you turn, you can find someone who needs you. Even if it is a little thing, do something for which there is no pay but the privilege of doing it. Remember, you don't live in the world all of your own.
If you become a helper of hearts, springs of wisdom will flow from your heart.
If our hopes of building a better and safer world are to become more than wishful thinking, we will need the engagement of volunteers more than ever.
Speak a word of affirmation at the right moment in a child's life and it's like lighting up a whole roomful of possibilities.
Biology is the least of what makes someone a mother.
Having kids—the responsibility of rearing good, kind, ethical, responsible human beings—is the biggest job anyone can embark on.
There is no such thing as a perfect parent so just be a real one.
Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print; experience is what you get when you don't.
Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.
True education does not consist merely in the acquiring of a few facts of science, history, literature, or art, but in the development of character.
One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world.
Education is the way to move mountains, to build bridges, to change the world.
The Earth is a fine place and worth fighting for.
I believe the world is incomprehensibly beautiful—an endless prospect of magic and wonder.
Nature is painting for us, day after day, pictures of infinite beauty.

Knowing that you love the earth changes you, activates you to defend and protect and celebrate. But when you feel that the earth loves you in return, that feeling transforms the relationship from a one-way street into a sacred bond.
No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.

I have never been a millionaire. But I have enjoyed a great meal, a crackling fire, a glorious sunset, a walk with a friend, a hug from a child, a cup of soup, a kiss behind the ear. There are plenty of life's tiny delights for all of us.
Appreciation…acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts.
The most fortunate are those who have a wonderful capacity to appreciate again and again, freshly and naively, the basic goods of life, with awe, pleasure, wonder.
The legacy of heroes is the memory of a great name and the inheritance of a great example.
Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting.
We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life.
Be humble in your confidence yet courageous in your character.
Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less.
Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence.
It's what you learn after you know it all that counts.
Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence.
You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.
There are no mistakes in life, only lessons. There is no such thing as a negative experience, only opportunities to grow, learn and advance along the road of self-mastery.
The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
It is your response to winning and losing that makes you a winner or a loser.
Victory is in the quality of the competition, not just the final score.
Somewhere behind the athlete you've become and the hours of practice and the coaches who have pushed you is a little girl who fell in love with the game and never looked back… play for her.
Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
Ask not what your teammates can do for you. Ask what you can do for your teammates.
Don't be satisfied with stories of how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves.
Your success will be determined by your own confidence and fortitude.
Make yourself proud.
Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
Just one smile, immensely increases the beauty, of the universe.
All the statistics in the world can't measure the warmth of a smile.
A smile is happiness you'll find right under your nose.
Smile, it is the key that fits the lock of everybody's heart.
Loyalty is a decision, a resolution of the soul.
Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable, than loyalty.
Loyalty is the strongest glue—which makes a relationship last a lifetime.
There may be people that have more talent than you, but there's no excuse for anyone to work harder than you do.
When you live for a strong purpose, hard work isn't an option. It's a necessity.
Success isn't always about greatness. It's about consistency. Consistent hard work leads to success. Greatness will come.
Successful people are not gifted; they just work hard, then succeed on purpose.
I know the price of success: dedication, hard work, and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
Taking care of yourself doesn't mean me first, it means me too.
A kind word is like a spring day.
My mission in life is to be kind, compassionate, caring, and loving in order to find and feel the deepest joy of life.
I feel the capacity to care is the thing which gives life its deepest significance.
Never believe that a few caring people can't change the world. For, indeed, that's all who ever have.
Don't be afraid to expand yourself, to step out of your comfort zone. That's where the joy and the adventure lie.
At times you have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover is yourself.
For what it's worth: it's never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be.

Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn't do than by the ones you did. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
Embrace uncertainty. Some of the most beautiful chapters in our lives won't have a title until much later.
The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said.
There's a lot of difference between listening and hearing.
Listening is a magnetic and strange thing, a creative force. The friends who listen to us are the ones we move toward. When we are listened to, it creates us, makes us unfold and expand.

If human beings are perceived as potentials rather than problems, as possessing strengths instead of weaknesses, as unlimited rather than dull and unresponsive, then they thrive and grow to their capabilities.
Find the good—and praise it.
I have yet to find a man or woman, however exalted their station, who did not do better work and put forth greater effort under a spirit of approval than under a spirit of criticism.
Promise yourself to be just as enthusiastic about the success of others as you are about your own.
Be aware of what others are doing, applaud their efforts, acknowledge their successes, and encourage them in their pursuits. When we all help one another, everybody wins.
Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
The basic root of happiness lies in our minds; outer circumstances are nothing more than adverse or favorable.
The mind is just like a muscle—the more you exercise it, the stronger it gets and the more it can expand.
In the end, just three things matter: How well we have lived. How well we have loved. How well we have learned to let go.
The most precious gift we can offer others is our presence. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers.

For a seed to achieve its greatest expression, it must come completely undone. The shell cracks, its insides come out and everything changes. To someone who doesn't understand growth, it would look like complete destruction.
Use what you've been through as fuel, believe in yourself and be unstoppable!
Turn your wounds into wisdom.
Every trial endured and weathered in the right spirit makes a soul nobler and stronger than it was before.
I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that.

A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.
True beauty does not shine; it attracts.
To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don't need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself.
True beauty is born through our actions and aspirations and in the kindness we offer to others.
Every experience is a stitch in the fabric of your character.
Adversity does not build character, it reveals it.
If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of itself.
Nature is not matter only. She is also spirit.
To walk into nature is to witness a thousand miracles.

I speak not for myself but for those without voice… those who have fought for their rights… their right to live in peace, their right to be treated with dignity, their right to equality of opportunity, their right to be educated.
I would like to be known as a person who is concerned about freedom and equality and justice and prosperity for all people.
Honesty, equality, kindness, compassion, treating people the way you want to be treated and helping those in need. To me, those are traditional values.
Never, never be afraid to do what's right.
I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
It may take courage to embrace the possibilities of your own potential, but once you've flown past the summit of your fears, nothing will seem impossible.
You can choose courage, or you can choose comfort, but you cannot choose both.
I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning to sail my ship.
Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
At the height of laughter, the universe is flung into a kaleidoscope of new possibilities.
Laugh my friend, for laughter ignites a fire within the pit of your belly and awakens your being.
Remember, laughter is 10 times more powerful than screams.
There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
The magic in new beginnings is truly the most powerful of them all.
I close my eyes to old ends. And open my heart to new beginnings.
What a wonderful thought it is that some of the best days of our lives haven't even happened yet.
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do.

And the Grinch, with his Grinch-feet ice cold in the snow, stood puzzling and puzzling, how could it be so? It came without ribbons. It came without tags. It came without packages, boxes or bags. And he puzzled and puzzled 'till his puzzler was sore. Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before. What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store? What if Christmas, perhaps, means a little bit more?
The love in your heart wasn't put there to stay. Love isn't love 'til you give it away.
My family is my life, and everything else comes second as far as what's important to me.
Family and friends are hidden treasures, seek them and enjoy their riches.
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
At the end of the day, it's not about what you have or even what you've accomplished… It's about who you've lifted up, who you've made better. It's about what you've given back.
We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
Joy; the kind of happiness that doesn't depend on what happens.
Just follow your joy. Always. I think that if you do that, life will take you on the course that it's meant to take you.
Joy is not in things; it is in us.
Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lit the flame within us.
Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
Spirit is like the wind, in that we can't see it but can see its effects, which are profound.
It is the soul's duty to be loyal to its own desires. It must abandon itself to its master passion.
A smile is a light in the window of the soul indicating that the heart is at home.
Each person has an ideal, a hope, a dream which represents the soul. We must give to it the warmth of love, the light of understanding and the essence of encouragement.
Neither genius, fame, nor love show the greatness of the soul. Only kindness can do that.
That's what kindness is. It's not doing something for someone else because they can't, but because you can.
Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
One kind word can warm three winter months.
We cannot reach the goal by mere words alone. Without practice, nothing can be achieved.

Do it again. Play it again. Sing it again. Read it again. Write it again. Sketch it again. Rehearse it again. Run it again. Try it again.
Because again is practice, and practice is improvement.
It's not necessarily the amount of time you spend at practice that counts; it's what you put into the practice.
Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. You have to fail in order to practice being brave.
Practice is the best of all instructors.

We can each define ambition and progress for ourselves. The goal is to work toward a world where expectations are not set by the stereotypes that hold us back, but by our personal passion, talents and interests.
Don't be afraid to be ambitious about your goals. Hard work never stops. Neither should your dreams.
Ambition is a dream with a V8 engine.
Although time seems to fly by, it never travels faster than one day at a time. Each day is a new opportunity to live your life to the fullest.
The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
Whatever you want to do, do it now! There are only so many tomorrows.
Life is a great and wondrous mystery, and the only thing we know that we have for sure is what is right here right now. Don't miss it.
To be able to look back upon one's life in satisfaction, is to live twice.
Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!
I believe we each walk our paths so we can learn and share those lessons with others.
There is no joy in possession without sharing.
Three keys to more abundant living: caring about others, daring for others, sharing with others.
Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
The miracle is this: the more we share the more we have.
Make up your mind that no matter what comes your way, no matter how difficult, no matter how unfair, you will do more than simply survive. You will thrive in spite of it.
Tough times never last, but tough people do.
You never know how strong you are until being strong is the only choice you have.
An essential aspect of creativity is not being afraid to fail.
The most powerful, efficient energy source in the world is your own mind.  Explore and discover that it can make creative fuel from anything.
A will finds a way.
Obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it or work around it.
A dream doesn't become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination.
Never, never, never give up.
Passion is one great force that unleashes creativity, because if you're passionate about something, then you're more willing to take risks.
Purpose is the reason you journey. Passion is the fire that lights the way.
Nothing is as important as passion. No matter what you want to do with your life, be passionate.
Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
I think tolerance and acceptance and love is something that feeds every community.

Our uniqueness, our individuality, and our life experience molds us into fascinating beings. I pray we may all challenge ourselves to delve into the deepest resources of our hearts to cultivate an atmosphere of understanding, acceptance, tolerance, and compassion. We are all in this life together.
True belonging doesn't require you to change who you are; it requires you to be who you are.
Our job on earth isn't to criticize, reject, or judge. Our purpose is to offer a helping hand, compassion, and mercy. We are to do unto others as we hope they would do unto us.
I believe that the greatest kindness is acceptance.
And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.
A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.
It is important to remember that we cannot become what we need to be, by remaining what we are.
Live your life by a compass, not a clock.
No one can really predict to what heights you might soar. Even you will not know until you spread your wings.
Courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest in the grateful and appreciating heart.
The small courtesies sweeten life; the greater, ennoble it.
Courtesy is a small act but it packs a mighty wallop.
There is a courtesy of the heart; it is allied to love. From it springs the purest courtesy in the outward behavior.
No legacy is so rich as honesty.
Honesty is the fastest way to prevent a mistake from turning into a failure.
We know the truth, not only by the reason, but also by the heart.
There is nothing so strong or safe in an emergency of life as the simple truth.
Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people.
Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
No matter how dark the moment, love and hope are always possible.
Happiness can be found in even the darkest of times, but only to those who remember to turn on the light.
Expect to have hope rekindled. Expect your prayers to be answered in wondrous ways. The dry seasons do not last. The spring rains will come.
Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
Treat people as if they were what they ought to be, and you help them become what they are capable of being.
The greatest leaders are not necessarily the ones who do the greatest things. They are the ones that inspire others to do great things.
Leaders who win the respect of others are the ones who deliver more than they promise, not the ones who promise more than they can deliver.
A leader is someone who demonstrates what's possible.
Great things can be achieved by leading through wisdom, empathy, and integrity—with no other agenda than humanity.
Above everything else I've done, I've always said I've had more guts than I've got talent.

You cannot talk about grit—you have to embody it.
You cannot talk about faith—you have to live it.
You cannot talk about the desert—you have to cross it.
Every great story happened when someone decided not to give up.

Grit is not just a simple elbow-grease term for rugged persistence. It is an often invisible display of endurance that lets you stay in an uncomfortable place, work hard to improve upon a given interest and do it again and again.
What is grit? Grit is refusing to give up. It's persistence. It's making your own luck.
Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope, and that enables you to laugh at life's realities.
A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
A day without laughter is a day wasted.
Freedom means the opportunity to be what we never thought we would be.
In the truest sense, freedom cannot be bestowed; it must be achieved.
May we think of freedom not as the right to do as we please, but as the opportunity to do what is right.
Peace and justice are two sides of the same coin.
What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived. It is what difference we have made to the lives of others that will determine the significance of the life we lead.
We can choose to be affected by the world or we can choose to affect the world.
I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough, we must do.
Don't just aspire to make a living. Aspire to make a difference.
To err is human, to forgive, divine.
You don't have to accept the invitation to get angry. Instead, practice forgiveness, empathy and encouragement.
We must develop and maintain the capacity to forgive. He who is devoid of the power to forgive is devoid of the power to love.
Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
To understand is to forgive, even oneself.
Grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.

To be courageous requires no exceptional qualifications, no magic formula. It's an opportunity that sooner or later is presented to us all and each person must look for that courage in their own soul.
Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear.
Most of our obstacles would melt away if, instead of cowering before them, we should make up our minds to walk boldly through them.
This is the art of courage: to see things as they are and still believe that the victory lies not with those who avoid the bad, but those who taste, in living awareness, every drop of the good.
Do not count the days; make the days count.
I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.
When it comes time to die, let us not discover that we have never lived.
Be fearless in the pursuit of what sets your soul on fire.
Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
Endeavor to see the good in every situation.
Mindfulness is a way of befriending ourselves and our experience.
Looking at beauty in the world, is the first step of purifying the mind.
It's your place in the world; it's your life. Go on and do all you can with it, and make it the life you want to live.
I go to seek a Great Perhaps.
There is no passion to be found playing small, in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
Family means putting your arms around each other and being there.
Be there for others, but never leave yourself behind.
Never be so busy as not to think of others.
Just being there for someone can sometimes bring hope when all seems hopeless.
If you love someone, the greatest gift you can give them is your presence.
Kids don't remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are.
We must become what we wish to teach.
Teaching kids to count is fine, but teaching them what counts is best.
The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.

An understanding heart is everything in a teacher, and cannot be esteemed highly enough. One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers, but with gratitude to those who touched our human feeling.
A man without a purpose is like a ship without a rudder.
The heart of human excellence often begins to beat when you discover a pursuit that gives you a sense of meaning, joy, or passion.
I am not afraid. I was born to do this.
It's not so much how busy you are, but why you are busy.
We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
We are called to assist the Earth to heal her wounds and in the process heal our own.
My mission is to create a world where we can live in harmony with nature.
I think of a hero as someone who understands the degree of responsibility that comes with his freedom.
Work and live to serve others, leave the world a little better than you found it.
Generosity consists not the sum given, but the manner in which it is bestowed.
Charity and love are the same—with charity you give love, so don't just give money but reach out your hand instead.
Charity is the root of all good works.
In necessary things, unity; in disputed things, liberty; in all things, charity.
Luck to me is something else; hard work and realizing what is opportunity and what isn't.
The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
If it wasn't hard, everyone would do it. It's the hard that makes it great.
There is no development physically or intellectually without effort, and effort means work.
The rarest, truest beauty is visible only to the heart.
People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.
Happiness and confidence are the prettiest things you can wear.
Outer beauty pleases the eye. Inner beauty captivates the heart.
The most important thing in the world is family and love.
In family life, love is the oil that eases friction, the cement that binds closer together.
Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family.
Families are the compass that guides us.
Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.
Nature is not a place to visit. It is home.
For it is in giving that we receive.
Do something for those who have need of a man's help, Something for which you get no pay but the privilege of doing it.
You are what you give; not what you are given.
Try to be like the turtle, at ease in your own shell.
You have a chance every single morning to make that change and be the person you want to be. You just have to decide to do it.
To be a champ you have to believe in yourself when no one else will.
In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
There's a difference between doing things right and doing the right thing.
Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.
Life is a matter of choices, and every choice you make makes you.
It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
A leader is someone willing to give his strength to others so that they may have the strength to stand on their own.
Leadership is unlocking people's potential to become better.
Leadership is a two-way street. Respect for one's superiors; care for one's crew.
Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
He who plants kindness gathers love.
The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the grandest intention.
There is one spectacle grander than the sea, that is the sky; there is one spectacle grander than the sky, that is the interior of the soul.
Whatever the soul knows how to seek, it cannot fail to obtain.
Strong is the soul, kind, and wise, and beautiful.
The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
The key to everything is patience. You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it.
Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
I will sprinkle compliments and uplifting words everywhere I go.
Sincere compliments cost nothing and can accomplish much.
If you see someone and they strike you as beautiful in any way, why not let them know?
I can live for two months on a good compliment.
There is no effect more disproportionate to its cause than the happiness bestowed by a small compliment.
And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places.
Magic is the experience of waking up and seeing things the way you saw them before they became ordinary.
It is a happiness to wonder—it is a happiness to dream.
The more I wonder, the more I love.
We are all travelers in the wilderness of this world, and the best we can find in our travels is an honest friend.
When being together is more important than what you do, you are with a friend.
There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
A friend is one that knows you as you are, understands where you have been, accepts what you have become, and still, gently allows you to grow.
In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
Certain things catch your eye, but pursue only those that capture the heart.
Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
If you really want to do something, you will work hard for it.
For last year's words belong to last year's language. And next year's words await another voice. And to make an end is to make a beginning.
Don't try to be perfect; Just be an excellent example of a human being.

I am not this hair, I am not this skin, I am the soul that lives within.
Nobody is superior, nobody is inferior, but nobody is equal either. People are simply unique, incomparable. You are you, I am I.

As you grow up, always tell the truth, do no harm to others, and don't think you are the most important being on earth. Rich or poor, you then can look anyone in the eye and say, 'I'm probably no better than you, but I'm certainly your equal.
We become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams.
We may have different religions, different languages, different colored skin, but we all belong to one human race. We all share the same basic values.
We are the music-makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams. We are the movers and shakers of the world forever, it seems.

What if it becomes less about how we look and more about how much we care? What if it becomes less about how much money we earn and more about how much we share our good fortune? Imagine a world where who we are in our hearts is the ultimate status symbol.
Can you imagine what I would do if I could do all I can?
You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination

Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard. Do not let pain make you hate. Do not let the bitterness steal your sweetness. Take pride that even though the rest of the world may disagree, you still believe it to be a beautiful place.
Faith is to believe what you do not yet see; the reward for this faith is to see what you believe.
Everything will be okay in the end. If it's not okay, it's not the end.
Believe you can and you're halfway there.
No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.

Those who make compassion an essential part of their lives find the joy of life. Kindness deepens the spirit and produces rewards that cannot be completely explained in words. It is an experience more powerful than words. To become acquainted with kindness one must be prepared to learn new things and feel new feelings. Kindness is more than a philosophy of the mind. It is a philosophy of the spirit.
It's never too late to be what you might have been.
The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
Anyone can look for fashion in a boutique or history in a museum. The creative explorer looks for history in a hardware store and fashion in an airport.
Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.

To be creative means to be in love with life. You can be creative only if you love life enough that you want to enhance its beauty, you want to bring a little more music to it, a little more poetry to it, a little more dance to it.
Creativity is intelligence having fun.
Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
When you are joyful, when you say yes to life and have fun and project positivity all around you, you become a sun in the center of every constellation, and people want to be near you.
When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.
Joy is a decision, a really brave one, about how you are going to respond to life.
Joy is a net of love in which you can catch souls.
The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.
Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
Most of us serve our ideals by fits and starts. The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
Dedication involves making the space to let young ideas take hold; every tree was once a seed and every company was once an idea.
Dedicate some of your life to others. Your dedication will not be a sacrifice. It will be an exhilarating experience because it is an intense effort applied toward a meaningful end.

I will follow the upward road today; I will keep my face to the light. I will think high thoughts as I go my way; I will do what I know is right. I will look for the flowers by the side of the road; I will laugh and love and be strong. I will try to lighten another's load this day as I fare along.
A smile starts on the lips, a grin spreads to the eyes, a chuckle comes from the belly; but a good laugh bursts forth from the soul, overflows, and bubbles all around.
The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.

Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me… Anything can happen, child. Anything can be.
When you realize nothing is lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
Happiness is your nature. It is not wrong to desire it. What is wrong is seeking it outside when it is inside.
Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand-and melting like a snowflake…
This is part of what a family is about, not just love. It's knowing that your family will be there watching out for you. Nothing else will give you that. Not money. Not fame. Not work.

You can kiss your family and friends good-bye and put miles between you, but at the same time you carry them with you in your heart, your mind, your stomach, because you do not just live in a world but a world lives in you.
Home is people. Not a place. If you go back there after the people are gone, then all you can see is what is not there any more.

I have never met a person whose greatest need was anything other than real, unconditional love. You can find it in a simple act of kindness toward someone who needs help. There is no mistaking love…it is the common fiber of life, the flame that heats our soul, energizes our spirit and supplies passion to our lives.
To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
Until he extends his circle of compassion to include all living things, man will not himself find peace.
We look forward to the time when the power to love will replace the love of power. Then will our world know the blessing of peace.
Peace, like charity, begins at home.
Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others.

The only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work, and the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking, and don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it. And like any great relationship, it just gets better and better as the years roll on. So keep looking, don't settle.
I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.

I began to realize how important it was to be an enthusiast in life. He taught me that if you are interested in something, no matter what it is, go at it at full speed ahead. Embrace it with both arms, hug it, love it and above all become passionate about it. Lukewarm is no good. Hot is no good either. White hot and passionate is the only thing to be.

Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded. It's a relationship between equals. Only when we know our own darkness well can we be present with the darkness of others. Compassion becomes real when we recognize our shared humanity.

Hurt people, hurt people. That's how pain patterns get passed on, generation after generation after generation. Break the chain today. Meet anger with sympathy, contempt with compassion and cruelty with kindness. Greet grimaces with smiles. Forgive and forget about finding fault. Love is the weapon of the future.

Compassion asks us to go where it hurts, to enter into the places of pain, to share in brokenness, fear, confusion, and anguish. Compassion challenges us to cry out with those in misery, to mourn with those who are lonely, to weep with those in tears. Compassion requires us to be weak with the weak, vulnerable with the vulnerable, and powerless with the powerless. Compassion means full immersion in the condition of being human.
If a person seems wicked, do not cast him away. Awaken him with your words, elevate him with your deeds, repay his injury with your kindness. Do not cast him away; cast away his wickedness.
You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
Let me not pray to be sheltered from dangers, but to be fearless in facing them.Let me not beg for the stilling of my pain, but for the heart to conquer it.

The lotus is the most beautiful flower, whose petals open one by one. But it will only grow in the mud. In order to grow and gain wisdom, first you must have the mud --- the obstacles of life and its suffering. … The mud speaks of the common ground that humans share, no matter what our stations in life. … Whether we have it all or we have nothing, we are all faced with the same obstacles: sadness, loss, illness, dying and death. If we are to strive as human beings to gain more wisdom, more kindness and more compassion, we must have the intention to grow as a lotus and open each petal one by one.
The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.

Grit is passion and perseverance for very long-term goals. Grit is having stamina. Grit is sticking with your future, day-in, day-out. Not just for the week, not just for the month, but for years. And working really hard to make that future a reality. Grit is living life like it's a marathon, not a sprint.
Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
True grit is making a decision and standing by it, doing what must be done. No moral man can have peace of mind if he leaves undone what he knows he should have done.
You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.
